text:
Raskolnikov stood, cap in hand. 

“Are you going for a walk?” Porfiry asked. 

“Yes, but don’t think I’ve confessed,” Raskolnikov replied. 

Porfiry smiled knowingly. “You’re trembling. Just walk. You won’t stray far.” 

Raskolnikov frowned. 

“Listen,” Porfiry said, lowering his voice. “If you think of ending it all, write a note. Just two lines. Mention the stone.” 

“Why would I do that?” Raskolnikov snapped. 

“Just in case,” Porfiry replied, stepping back. 

He left, avoiding Raskolnikov’s gaze. 

Raskolnikov stared out the window, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov insists he has not confessed to Porfiry, despite the latter's probing and concern for his well-being.
